A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an entry fee. She is then faced with having to go against him in the steeplechase at the risk of betraying her trusted trainer.

Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to James Bond — with one foot in the grave. After entering kidney failure, he agrees to one final hit. The target is an 80-year-old millionaire. 
Hunting down his prey is a boorish African-American child prodigy and a stylish blond femme fatale.
